title: Last surviving member of first team to scale Everest dies aged 92
byline: Kanchha Sherpa, the last surviving member of the first expedition to successfully scale the summit of Mount Everest, has died in the Nepali capital Kathmandu, aged 92.

title: Trump says he will meet Putin in Hungary for Ukraine talks after ‘very productive’ call
byline: US President Donald Trump says “great progress” was made during a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday, with the pair agreeing to face-to-face talks in Hungary.

title: Boat carrying suspected narcotics and 5 crew members arrested in Southern seas
byline: A boat carrying a stock of suspected narcotics has been apprehended by the Sri Lanka Navy in the Southern seas.

title: Agrarian Service Centre officer arrested for soliciting Rs. 1.2 mln bribe
byline: An Agricultural Research & Production Assistant has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), for soliciting a bribe of Rs. 1.2 million from a person to provide part of a government land for cultivation.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m, today (17), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Former Trump national security adviser John Bolton indicted
byline: John Bolton, President Donald Trump’s former national security adviser, was charged on Thursday in a sweeping indictment that accuses him of sharing sensitive government information with two of his relatives for possible use in a book he was writing.

title: Narcotics haul recovered from southern seas presented to court
byline: The narcotics haul recovered by the Sri Lanka Navy while floating in the sea off the southern coast has been presented before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Over 500 individuals arrested during island-wide police raids
byline: Over 500 individuals have been arrested by Police yesterday during island-wide crime and drug prevention operations aimed at apprehending suspects involved in various criminal activities.

title: Price of 24-carat gold sovereign nears Rs. 400,000
byline: The price of gold in Sri Lanka has risen significantly following the continuous increase in global gold prices.

title: Sri Lanka’s economic performance has improved – IMF
byline: Sri Lanka’s economic performance has improved following the debt restructuring process, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has stated.

title: Women’s Caucus proposes Parliament debate on breast cancer awareness
byline: A special awareness session on breast cancer prevention and related programs was held in Parliament for the Women Parliamentarians’ Caucus.

title: PM Harini Amarasuriya visits alma mater Hindu College in India
byline: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya on Thursday visited her alma mater, the Hindu College of Delhi University, reliving memories of her student days at the prestigious institution.

title: Maintaining fiscal discipline, reforming SOEs ‘crucial’ for Sri Lanka’s recovery - IMF
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has commended Sri Lanka’s continued progress under its economic reform program, highlighting strong growth momentum following the country’s recovery from a deep economic crisis.

title: Sri Lanka Customs records highest single-day revenue
byline: Sri Lanka Customs says it has recorded its highest one-day revenue of Rs. 24,918 million yesterday (October 15).

title: Derana Closeup Colombo Music Festival 2025 set to electrify with two shows and masterclasses
byline: Sri Lanka’s entertainment landscape is about to witness one of its most dynamic events yet as TV Derana, in collaboration with Closeup, presents the “Derana Closeup Colombo Music Festival 2025” — a two-day celebration of music, culture, and creativity.

title: Trump, Putin speak before Zelenskiy’s White House visit
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump was speaking on a call with his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, on Thursday, a day before Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s planned White House visit to seek more support in the war with Russia.

title: Over 100 families in four districts affected by adverse weather
byline: More than 100 families in four districts have been affected by prevailing adverse weather conditions across the country.

title: India, Sri Lanka discuss ways to strengthen cooperation in education & capacity building
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya has met India’s Minister of External Affairs Dr. S. Jaishankar in New Delhi today (16).

title: Donald Trump says PM Modi has agreed to stop buying Russian oil
byline: President Donald Trump has said Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has agreed to stop buying Russian oil, as the US seeks to put economic pressure on the Kremlin as part of efforts to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Former SECSL Director Dilhara Wijedasa arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Nilu Dilhara Wijedasa, the former Executive Director of the State Engineering Corporation of Sri Lanka (SECSL), has been arrested on bribery allegations.

title: UNP appoints three-member committee to hold discussions with SJB
byline: A three-member committee has been appointed by the United National Party (UNP) to hold discussions with the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB).

title: Body of a male found from temporary lodging facility in Divulapitiya
byline: A body of a male has been found inside a room of a temporary lodging facility in Balagalla, Divulapitiya, police stated.

title: Samsung Electronics shares hit record high
byline: Shares of South Korean chipmaker Samsung Electronics rose as much as 2 per cent on Thursday to an all-time high on investor optimism surrounding the semiconductor industry.

title: Former SECSL Director Dilhara Wijedasa granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of Nilu Dilhara Wijedasa, former Director of the State Engineering Corporation of Sri Lanka (SECSL).

title: Deepika Padukone becomes the voice of Meta AI across six countries
byline: Bollywood actress Deepika Padukone collaborated with Meta to become the new voice of its AI version across multiple countries.

title: US Ambassador clarifies Sri Lanka’s travel advisory status
byline: U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung has clarified that the U.S. Department of State’s travel advisory for Sri Lanka remains unchanged at Level 2.

title: Rs. 25 million in fines imposed on vendors who sold bottled drinking water at excessive prices
byline: Over Rs. 25 million in fines have been imposed on vendors who sold bottled drinking water at excessive prices, the Consumer Affairs Authority states.

title: Attorney Gunaratne Wanninayake appears before WP South Crimes division
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake, who was released on bail yesterday, appeared before the Western Province South Crimes Division this morning (16).

title: Court sets date to take up Attorney Gunaratne Wanninayake’s petition
byline: The Court of Appeal has fixed for consideration the writ petition filed by Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake, seeking an order to prevent his arrest in connection with an alleged incident at the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court premises, for 10 November 2025.

title: PM Harini lands in New Delhi for maiden visit to India after assuming office
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya has landed in New Delhi for her maiden visit to India after assuming office.

title: Shutdown could cost US economy $15 billion a week, Treasury says
byline: The two-week-old federal government shutdown may cost the U.S. economy as much as $15 billion a week in lost output, a Treasury official said late on Wednesday, correcting an earlier statement from Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent that put the cost at up to $15 billion per day.

title: Over 300,000 driver’s licenses to be issued within three months – Ministry officials
byline: Officials of the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation informed the Ministerial Consultative Committee that currently, more than 300,000 driver’s licenses are pending issuance, and arrangements have been made to print and distribute them within the next three months.

title: Army colonel plans to lead Madagascar after coup ousts civilian president
byline: Madagascar’s new military ruler, Colonel Michael Randrianirina, said he will be sworn in as president on Friday and was open to talks with the African Union, after it suspended the country’s membership following a coup to oust President Andry Rajoelina.

title: PNB Director transferred due to ongoing probe against him - sources
byline: Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Hemal Prashantha, who served as the Director of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) was transferred in connection with an ongoing investigation against him, according to sources from Police Headquarters.

title: Court informed of Customs’ decision on releasing detained vehicles
byline: The Court of Appeal was informed today (16) that vehicles detained for being imported from countries other than their country of manufacture, under letters of credit opened in Sri Lanka, may be released subject to specified conditions.

title: Police warn public about risks of online and mobile loan offers
byline: The Sri Lanka Police Headquarters has issued a public alert urging citizens to exercise caution when obtaining loans via the Internet or mobile phones, following an increase in complaints related to deceptive lending practices.

title: Low taxes and inequitable policies deepened Sri Lanka’s economic crisis - HRW
byline: Sri Lanka’s tax policies played a driving role in the country’s devastating 2022 economic crisis and have contributed to the chronic underfunding of education and other public services, Human Rights Watch said in a report released recently.

title: Former Kenyan PM Raila Odinga dies in India aged 80
byline: Former Prime Minister of Kenya Raila Odinga has died of cardiac arrest in Kerala, India.

title: Three police teams currently interrogating six suspects including ‘Ishara Sewwandi’
byline: Three police teams are currently interrogating six suspects, including ‘Ishara Sewwandi’, the fugitive female suspect wanted in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne alias ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa.’

title: No phone call between Trump and Modi: India rejects US President’s claim
byline: India on Thursday rejected outright US President Donald Trump’s claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a telephonic conversation with him, assuring that New Delhi would stop buying Russian oil.

title: India already cutting Russian oil imports by 50% after US talks, White House official says
byline: The United States and India have held productive trade talks, and Indian refiners are already cutting Russian oil imports by 50%, a White House official told Reuters on Thursday.

title: Suspect linked to double murder and multiple thefts arrested
byline: A suspect has been arrested in the Weeraketiya Police Division, based on information received by a team of officers from the Tangalle Divisional Crime Investigation Bureau, for aiding and abetting a double murder committed following a shooting on June 25 in the Middeniya Police Division.

title: SC dismisses petitions challenging India-Sri Lanka Digital ID MoU
byline: The Supreme Court of Sri Lanka has dismissed without hearing two fundamental rights petitions filed by former Minister Wimal Weerawansa and two other parties, ...

title: Price of 24-carat gold sovereign crosses Rs. 400,000 in Sri Lanka
byline: The price of gold in Sri Lanka has risen significantly following the continuous increase in global gold prices.

title: One dead, 2 injured after motorcycle–school van collision in Wennappuwa
byline: A motorcyclist died and two others were injured following a collision between a van transporting school children and a motorcycle at the Gorakgas Junction on the Wennappuwa New Road earlier this morning (17).

title: Magnitude 6.1 quake hits southern Philippines
byline: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake jolted southern Philippines on Friday (Oct 17), the United States Geological Survey said, a week after two powerful quakes hit the country.

title: Parliament to adopt amendments to Personal Data Protection Act next week
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka is scheduled to adopt amendments to the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) on October 21, 2025, during the Committee Stage, along with the Committee Stage Amendments.

title: Ex-President Mahinda’s Chief Security Officer further remanded
byline: Neville Wanniarachchi, the chief security officer of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, has been further remanded until October 31 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: BIA extends passenger check-in time to 4 hours before departure
byline: Effective from today (17), passengers departing from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake will be permitted to check-in up to four hours prior to their scheduled departure time.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: Samsung to showcase its first ever trifold phone at APEC summit
byline: Samsung Electronics Co. will unveil its highly-anticipated trifold smartphone when world leaders and global dignitaries gather at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in South Korea later this month. MORE:

title: 53kg of heroin found in boat intercepted in Southern seas
byline: The exact contents of the boat apprehended in the Southern seas by the Sri Lanka Navy, and escorted to the Galle Fisheries Harbour this morning (17), have been revealed by the navy.

title: Sri Lanka signs USD 100M loan and USD 6.9M grant agreements with ADB for health program
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka held discussions with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to mobilize a loan amounting to USD 100 million, coupled with an externally financed grant amounting to USD 6.9 million...

title: President convenes National Operations Council for ‘Ratama Ekata’ anti-drug program for first time
byline: The National Operations Council for the “Ratama Ekata - National Operation” convened for the first time today (17) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to implement a national program aimed at eradicating the drug menace, a national disaster currently facing the country, the PMD reported.

title: Three including police officer arrested for sheltering Ishara Sewwandi
byline: Three suspects including a Police Constable, his mother-in-law and a close associate of an organised criminal have been arrested for allegedly sheltering Ishara Sewwandi, the wanted fugitive who was recently arrested in Nepal and brought back to Sri Lanka.

title: New subsidised air ticket counter launched for migrant workers
byline: A new ticket counter offering air tickets at subsidised prices has been launched at the Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Agency (SLFEA) in Narahenpita, in accordance with the government’s new program for migrant workers leaving for foreign employment.

title: ‘Glad that President heeded our consistent critique of Penal Code amendment’ – Dilith
byline: ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ leader and Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera says he is glad that President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has heeded their consistent critique of a policy measure that would have “irreversibly harmed the growth of Sri Lanka’s primary and secondary education.”

title: ASPI records new all-time high
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) achieved a historic milestone today (17), as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 22,500-point mark for the first time in history.

title: BYD makes largest recall of over 115,000 cars due to design, battery issues
byline: Chinese car maker BYD will make its largest recall yet of more than 115,000 Tang series and Yuan Pro vehicles produced between 2015 and 2022 due to design defects and battery-related safety risks, China’s market regulator said on Friday.

title: Indian PM Modi holds bilateral discussions with Sri Lankan PM Harini
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that he was pleased to welcome Sri Lankan Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya for discussions on a wide range of bilateral and regional matters.

title: Heavy traffic on several roads in Colombo due to rain
byline: Severe traffic congestion has been reported on several roads in Colombo due to the prevailing heavy rains.

title: India’s neighbourhood first policy helping all: Sri Lanka PM At NDTV World Summit
byline: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today that India’s neighbourhood first policy is helping all the neighbouring countries.

title: Pakistan, Afghanistan extend ceasefire as Doha talks set to begin, sources say
byline: Pakistan and Afghanistan agreed on Friday to extend their 48-hour ceasefire until the conclusion of talks in Doha, according to three Pakistani security officials and one Afghan Taliban source.
